definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: Even the scabbards for the weapons were constructed from bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連刀鞘也是竹子做的。

sentences.english: The scabbard is content to be dull when it protects the keenness of the sword.
sentences.chinese: 刀鞘保護刀的鋒利，它自己則滿足於它的遲鈍。

sentences.english: The dagger stuck tightly in the silver scabbard.
sentences.chinese: 匕首牢牢地卡在銀質刀鞘中。

sentences.english: Sheaths are also made to command high appreciation and value.
sentences.chinese: 刀鞘被製作的具有很高的觀賞性和價值。

sentences.english: the scabbard is content to be dull when it protects the keenness of the sword.
sentences.chinese: 刀鞘庇護刀的尖銳，它本身則知足於它的癡鈍。

sentences.english: Do not encircle the scabbard with your fingers while drawing out your khukuri.
sentences.chinese: 不要在拔刀的時候用手指整個的握住刀鞘。

sentences.english: He drew his knife from its sheath.
sentences.chinese: 他把刀從刀鞘裏抽出來。

sentences.english: He lowered it and drew his hunting-knife from its beaded sheath at his hip.
sentences.chinese: 他放下槍，從臀部的鑲珠刀鞘中拔出他的獵刀。

sentences.english: In loose cases, always make sure to keep the blade and scabbard separately when storing.
sentences.chinese: 刀鞘鬆垮的時候，一定要注意刀和刀鞘分開儲放。

sentences.english: In loose cases, always make sure to keep the blade and scabbard separately when storing.
sentences.chinese: 刀鞘鬆垮的時候，一定要注意刀和刀鞘分開儲放。

sentences.english: Have you put the knife in the case?
sentences.chinese: 你把刀插回刀鞘裏了嗎？
